clinical_study.brief_title: Using a Novel Functional MRI Technique to Evaluate for Neurotoxicity
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Resting State Functional Connectivity in Patients With Central Nervous System Lymphoma Receiving High Dose Chemotherapy and Autologous Stem Cell Transplant

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test resting state functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging (rsfMRI) scans to see if rsfMRI scans are better than the standard task based fMRI scans at diagnosing or monitoring central nervous system lymphoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in resting state brain networks over time in participants with central nervous system lymphoma before and after treatment with high-dose chemotherapy with autologous stem cell transplantation through resting state fMRI results

arm_group.description: Participants will have non-Hodgkins lymphoma involving the brain (primary or secondary)

intervention.description: rsfMRI before receiving High-dose chemotherapy with autologous stem cell transplantation/HDC-ASCT (pre-HDC-ASCT), at approximately 3 months (+/- 2 weeks) after HDC-ASCT (early post-HDC-ASCT) and approximately 6months (+/- 2 weeks) after HDC-ASCT (late post-HDC-ASCT).

intervention.intervention_name: Auditory Attention and Executive Functions Test
intervention.description: Trail Making Test (Parts A & B): Part A is a timed test of visual scanning and graphomotor speed; AT: 3 minutes. Part B is a timed measure of set-shifting; Administration Time (AT): 5 minutes. Test-retest reliabilities=0.64-0.94. Brief Test of Attention-BTA assesses auditory working memory; AT: 10 minutes. Test-re-test reliability=0.70. Controlled Oral Word Association Test-COWAT is a timed measure of phonemic verbal fluency. It requires the subject to generate as many words as possible, beginning with a given letter of the alphabet (i.e., F, A, and S). The subject is allowed 60 seconds per letter, and the resultant score is the total number of words produced. Test-retest reliability=0.88. AT: 5 minutes.
The Hopkins Verbal Learning Test-Revised (HVLT-R): The HVLT-R is a test of verbal learning and memory.
Grooved Pegboard Test (GPT)-Dominant Hand and Non-Dominant Hand. It is a timed test of manual dexterity, in which the time to completion is scored separately for each hand.

intervention.intervention_name: Self Reported Quality of Life Questionnaire
intervention.description: The Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy-Brain Cancer (FACT-BR Version 4) consists of 46 questions with five domains assessing physical well-being, social/family well-being, emotional well-being, functional well being, additional concerns. The neuropsychological and QOL assessments will be performed by a neuropsychologist or by a trained RSA under the neuropsychologist's direct supervision.

study_pop.textblock: Potential research subjects will be identified by a member of the patient's treatment team, listed protocol investigators, or Neuroradiology research team at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Immunocompetent patients with newly diagnosed or recurrent non-Hodgkins lymphoma involving the brain (primary or secondary), as demonstrated by MRI and histologic confirmation either by positive CSF cytology for lymphoma or a monoclonal lymphocyte population defined by cell surface markers, vitreous or uvea biopsy or brain biopsy
- Age 18-80 years
- Treatment plan for HDC-ASCT
- Fluent in English
- Patients who in the judgment of the investigators and/or consenting professional, are able to understand the purpose of the study and provide informed consent will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Claustrophobia
- Any contraindication to the use of contrast and/or general guidelines for MR imaging as per standard Department of Radiology imaging guidelines
- Unable to cooperate for MRI
